description: The XMPP support is lacking almost all modern extensions. No persistent group chats, no recent converstions, no encryption, ...

Support for XEP has improved a lot in the last few months. 
It's still in it's infancy, but I am quite impressed.
Fetching room history has improved a lot with XMPP, encryption is being worked ont

I'm using it with an usb modem that uses a prepaid sim card... I have internet access with it and I can send / receive sms through this app. It used to have a delay of 1m when receiving sms, but it's FIXED with the new update! Now both sending and receiving sms is happening instantly. The integration with Gnome contacts makes this perfect! I love sms way more on desktop than on my phone now because of your app! Thank you for your efforts, you're the best!
summary: Best SMS app for gnome!! It works perfectly!

description: No sending or receiving images. No group messaging. Standard SMS works and I can send messages via telegram (btw the user id is +"country code""phonenumber".)

The SMS text works dependably still a little rough around the edges.
Great work in Progress !

This app never fails me! I use it with a 4g modem and all sms works, both receiving and sending stuff. A must have if you don't wanna use a phone and need the fuction of sms on your laptop / pc! The GUI Modem Manager app does the job too, but the dates are incorrect all the time and it doesn't look as good as this, so honestly this looks like the only app that's convenient, pretty and functional enough to use regualrily for sms! Keep this alive at all costs!!
Works good most of the time on Mobian /Pinephone sometimes i have to reboot to open this app... I'm on Nightly release of Bookworm.

Chat displays notifications that a Skype contact has sent in the notifications panel on a PinePhone but I have not found a way to find the messages in Chat to reply to them. Pidgin does not have this problem.
Chat also stop Pidgin from starting so I have uninstalled Chat for the time being.

It is working great on my original Pine phone, and now on my Pine Explorer edition phone.
Both use Mobian/Bookworm.
